string.text: A standard round for the Colt M1911 and the SIG P220 pistols. It has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
An Hydro-Shock round with improved characteristics for the Colt M1911 and the SIG P220 pistols. It has a hollow-point bullet with a good stopping effect.

A standard 12 caliber round filled with 6mm buckshot. Has enormous killing power at a close range. Designed for the BM-16, the Winchester M1300, and the SPAS-12 shotguns. Most effective at ranges under 30 meters.

A finned bullet. Stabilizes in flight, which greatly increases its accuracy. Designed for the TOZ-34, the BM-16, the Winchester M1300, and the SPAS-12 shotguns. Has an armor-piercing effect and an increased range. Effective at a range of up to 150 meters.

A round with a heavy, naked bullet. Mostly used for big game hunting, but can be used for other purposes. Its heavy bullet does not pierce, but forces itself through bulletproof vests. Designed for the TOZ-34, the BM-16, the Winchester M1300, and the SPAS-12 shotguns. Effective range is up to 100 meters.
An armor-piercing round for the AK-74, the AK-74SU and the AN-94 "Abakan" assault rifles. Has an improved armor-piercing effect, but decreased stopping power.
A standard round for the AK-74, the AK-74SU, and the AN-94 "Abakan" assault rifles. Has a standard core and a full-jacketed bullet.
A round with an armor-piercing bullet for the Enfield L85A2, the LR-300, the SIG-550, the HK G36, and the FN F2000 assault rifles.
A standard NATO round widely-known under its Belgian SS109 index. Used with the Enfield L85A2, the LR-300, the SIG-550, the HK G36, and the FN F2000 assault rifles.
A cheap modification of the sniper round for the SVD and SVU sniper rifles.
A sniper round for the SVD and SVU sniper rifles. Has an improved accuracy and range.
A sniper round with an armor-piercing bullet for the SVD and SVU sniper rifles.

The 7.62x54mmR is a Russian rifle cartridge dating back to 1891. Originally designed for the bolt-action Mosin-Nagant rifle, it was used during the late Tsarist era and throughout the Soviet period to the present day, in machine guns and rifles such as the SVT-40. This cartridges remains one of the few standard issue rimmed cartridges still in military use. The American Winchester Model 1895 was also chambered for this cartridge per a contract with the Russian government. The 7.62x54mmR is still in use by the Russian military in the Dragunov and other sniper rifles and some modern machine guns such as the PKM. In addition, it is used in the Romanian PSL sniper rifle, Yugoslavian M76, and the Chinese NDM-86 Dragunov variant. Historically, the round was known as the "7.62mm Russian" (and is still often referred to as such colloquially), but the "R" in the modern designation (7.62x54R) stands for Rimmed, in line with standard C.I.P designations. The name is sometimes confused with the "7.62 Soviet" round, which refers to the 7.62x39mm cartridge used in the SKS and AK-47 rifles.
A standard round for the PM, PB, and Fort 12 pistols. Has a standard core and full-jacketed bullet with a weak armor-piercing effect.

A round with improved ballistic characteristics for the PM, PB, and Fort 12 pistols. More effective than a standard round due to the high initial velocity of the bullet. Has a higher armor-piercing effect.
A standard round for the Walther P99 pistol and the HK MP5A5 submachine gun. Has a full-jacketed bullet with a weak armor-piercing effect.
An improved round for the Walther P99 and the HK MP5A5 submachine gun. A high-powered round with a hollow-point bullet and an armor-piercing core.

An armor-piercing round for the OC-14 "Groza", the AS "Val", and the VSS "Vintorez" sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which, due to its special design, can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 400 meters.

A round for the OC-14 "Groza", the AS "Val", and the VSS "Vintorez" sniper rifle. The later and cheaper modification of the armor-piercing round. Has a subsonic bullet which, due to its special design, can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 300 meters.

A sniper round for the OC-14 "Groza", the AS "Val", and the VSS "Vintorez" sniper rifle. It has a subsonic bullet which due to its heavy weight and special design can penetrate most bulletproof vests at a range of up to 400 meters.
Energy cells prepared with lethal elements in a Gauss rifle magazine. The energy source is an encapsulated piece of the Flash Artifact.
A 40mm grenade for the M203 grenade launcher (for the LR-300, G36, SIG-550, and L85A2 rifles) and the integrated grenade launcher of the FN F2000.
A highly-explosive 40mm fragmentation warhead for the RPG-7. Equally effective against troops and light armored vehicles.
A 40mm grenade for the GP-25 grenade launcher, the OC-14 "Groza"'s integrated grenade launcher, and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher.

A 40mm grenade for the GP-25 grenade launcher, the OC-14 "Groza"'s integrated grenade launcher, and the RG-6 revolver grenade launcher. Prior to explosion, the grenade leaps in to the air about one meter, increasing its kill effectiveness.
A defensive hand grenade with a large radius of shrapnel damage. It is recommended to throw it only from behind cover.
A smoke grenade. Creates a smoke screen for cover. Lasts for 10 seconds.
An offensive hand grenade with a small radius of shrapnel damage.

The weapon of the elite troops in the Russian Army. Designed as a replacement for the outdated AK-74. The Abakan’s receiver and barrel are movable, which helps decrease recoil and increase accuracy.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.45x39mm
 Armor-Piercing 5.45x39mm BP
A modified AN-94 fitted with an optic sight for carrying out sniper fire. The optics embedded into the body of the weapon has a higher resolution than the standard model.
A modified AN-94 fitted with an integrated granade launcher under the barrel, making it an even more versatile weapon.
A grenade launcher for the AK-74 and AK-74SU.\n Ammunition:\n VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades
A grenade launcher for the SIG-550, the LR-300, the G36 and the L85A2.\n Ammunition:\n M209 grenades
A widely used Soviet scope. The scope can be mounted on a weapon using a dovetail mount used by the Warsaw Pact countries.
A 4X scope produced in the NATO countries. It can be attached to a standard NATO mount, AKA the "Picatinny Rail".
An effective silencer made by Zone gunsmiths. The kit includes a set of adapters for weapons of any caliber.

A 1974 model assault rifle with a folding stock. Uses 5.45x39mm ammunition. A simple and reliable weapon, but its production quality affects the gun's ergonomics and accuracy. The main weapon of choice for Stalkers and "lone wolves".
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.45x39mm
 Armor-Piercing 5.45x39mm BP
An enhanced variant of the AK-74, fitted with a modified closing system that increases the rifle's rate of fire.

The weight and size of the AK-74SU are similar to those of a Submachine Gun, but its mode of operation and the ammunition type it uses place it into the class of Assault Rifles. Its small dimensions are very useful when fighting inside a building or within a thick forest, and has relatively high piercing capabilities. Its main disadvantages are a limited accuracy range and quick overheating when firing bursts.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.45x39mm
 Armor-Piercing 5.45x39mm BP
An enhanced variant of the AK-74SU. Fitted with a non-removable silencer.

Adopted by the American army and police, as well as many military and police units all over the world. It is especially popular among criminals for its high-powered rounds and high-capacity magazine.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x19mm FMJ
 Improved 9x19mm PB1s

This is a fast and reliable modification of a 9mm beretta, adopted by USAF as M9. It has a high-capacity magazine and can use a standard ammunition.
 Ammunition:
 standard 9x18 mm FMJ,
 9x18 PBP,
 improved 9x18 mm PB1s.

A double-barreled shotgun with shortened barrels. Lighter and more compact, but is only effective at close range. A weapon most commonly used by rookies.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 buckshot
 12x76 slug
 12x76 dart
A silenced variant of the Colt M1911 pistol - the weapon of choice by hired assassins. Fitted with a non-removable silencer.

A nice gun, which was presented in all the conflicts of the 20th century with honor and entered the new century with confidence. Its small-size magazine is partially compensated by the use of a high-powered round.
 Ammunition:
 standard .45 ACP,
 improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock.

Big, heavy, loud, and very destructive. Not very popular in the Zone due to its price and size. Besides, there aren't any elephants to hunt down around here!
 Ammunition:
 Standard .45 ACP
 Improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock
A variant of the Desert Eagle, modified to use rifle rounds. A devastating killing machine in Close Quarters Combat.

A modern bullpup assault rifle, equipped with an electronic fire control module and a 40-mm grenade launcher.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.56x45mm SS109
 Armor-Piercing 5.56x45mm AP

A pistol produced for the Ukrainian police force, which replaced the PM. Improved accuracy, ergonomics, and a larger magazine, but is less reliable.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x18mm
 Improved 9x18mm +P+
An experimental prototype of the Fort 12 pistol, designed to be its successor.

An assault rifle manufactured by Heckler and Koch in Germany. A first-grade specimen of modern weaponry: light, reliable, and ergonomic.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.56x45mm SS109
 Armor-Piercing 5.56x45mm AP

A super-accurate weapon made by Agroprom Research Institute scientists. Gunfire is nearly inaudible, due to its use of energy obtained "Flash" artifacts instead of gunpowder. In spite of the Flash Rifle’s tremendous firepower, the recoil is insignificant. The accuracy and power of this gun exceeds those of all other small arms.\n Ammunition: 2mm Flash rounds

An assault rifle with an attached grenade launcher. An ideal assault rifle for Zone conditions: compact, reliable, versatile, and powerful. A favorite among Stalkers.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x39mm PAB-9
 Armor-Piercing 9x39mm SP-6
 Sniper 9x39mm SP-5
 VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades
A OC-14 "Groza" with a modified barrel, which allows the rifle to utilize the more available 5.45mm round.

Considered as one of the best pistols of the 20th century. Reliable, powerful, and good accuracy. Magazine can hold 13 rounds.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x19mm FMJ
 Improved 9x19mm PB1s
A sharp, clip-point, stainless steel hunting knife.

After the British Army replaced this rifle with the HK G36, the L85A2 began appearing on the black market and the Zone in large quantities. The L85A2’s main advantage is a standard 4X scope. Highly accurate, but decreases in Burst fire mode. Internal mechanisms, however, are not reliable and are prone to jamming.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.56x45mm SS109
 Armor-Piercing 5.56x45mm AP
A modified Enlight L85A2 with diminished recoil using weights.
A modified Enlight L85A2 with an integrated silencer. Many parts were replaced with lighter components, making the weapon significantly lighter.

A light rifle with an effective fire range of up to 300 meters. Great ergonomics and lightweight, this weapon is highly accurate. However, it is sensitive to dirt and is not ideal for difficult field conditions.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.56x45mm SS109
 Armor-Piercing 5.56x45mm AP
A modified LR-300 capable of firing single shots. Geared to be used as a cheap alternative to a sniper rifle.

One of the best weapons in the Submachine Gun class. During the last decades of the 20th century, it was adopted by armies and special forces units in many countries. When it was gradually replaced with more up-to-date models, it appeared on the black market and in the Zone.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x19mm FMJ
 Improved 9x19mm PB1s
A HK MP5A5 submachine gun modified to utilize a more available round. A great, reliable submachine gun.
A HK MP5A5 submachine gun fitted with a non-removeable silencer.

A pistol with an integrated silencer and used by Soviet special forces. An outdated weapon, but is still very effective in skillful hands.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x18mm
 Improved 9x18mm +P+

The most widespread pistol in the Zone; a legacy of the Soviet era. Relatively reliable and cheap, it has a low magazine capacity, low power, and mediocre accuracy. The main weapon of a rookie Stalker.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x18mm
 Improved 9x18mm +P+

A revolver-type 40mm grenade launcher. An indispensable weapon, particularly when targeting large numbers of mutants, attacking well-guarded stationary objects, or fighting especially tough creatures.\n Ammunition: VOG-25 and VOG-25P grenades
A modified variant of the revolving grenade launcher, which is made to use M209 grenades.

A rocket-propelled grenade launcher, developed in the 1960s. RPGs are stored in large quantities in army depots, from where they are transferred to the Zone. Such weapons are rarely used by Stalkers: its huge dimensions and heavy weight make it unpopular, though it can be an indispensable weapon for certain missions.\n Ammunition: OG-7V warheads

An lightweight assault rifle geared for urban warfare. To lighten its weight, some parts were removed and/or replaced. As a result, there are no rails to attach a sight or a grenade launcher to the rifle.
A SIG SIG-550 modified for sniper fire. Fitted with a non-removeable optical sight.

A pistol developed in 1975, yet is still popular around the world. Has a low capacity magazine, but is extremely reliable and uses the high-powered .45 ACP round.
 Ammunition:
 Standard .45 ACP
 Improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock

A relatively new assault rifle utilizing the 5.56x45mm SS109 round. This weapon is very popular due to its accuracy, soft recoil, and high reliability.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 5.56x45mm SS109
 Armor-Piercing 5.56x45mm AP

The SPAS-12 is a smooth-bore shotgun that was developed in the late 1970s. This weapon is very reliable and relatively popular. However, it is large, expensive, and contains very complex mechanisms. An ideal weapon for Close Quarters Combat.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 buckshot
 12x76 slug
 12x76 dart

A uniquely modified SPAS-12 shotgun, which has a threaded bore that greatly increases its accuracy when firing slugs or darts.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 buckshot
 12x76 slug
 12x76 dart

Widely used in all operations of the Soviet and Russian armies until 1960. Proved to be an exceptionally reliable and handy weapon. Sniper rifle of choice by the experienced Stalkers of the "Duty" faction.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 7.62x54mm 7N1
 Armor-Piercing 7.62x54mm BP
 Sniper 7.62x54mm 7N14
A modified Dragunov SVD sniper rifle with improved optics, allowing the user to zoom in further. The rifle's weight is balanced, resulting in decreased recoil.

An updated variant of the Dragunov SVD sniper rifle. A compact bullpup model, which is excellent for long treks into the Zone.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 7.62x54mm 7N1
 Armor-Piercing 7.62x54mm BP
 Sniper 7.62x54mm 7N14

This hunting shotgun is popular, but there’s nothing noteworthy about it.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 buckshot
 12x76 slug
 12x76 dart

A very reliable pistol. A high-quality, compact, close-range weapon, it is very popular among the Zone veterans.
 Ammunition:
 Standard .45 ACP
 Improved .45 ACP Hydro-Shock

This weapon is based on the VSS "Vintorez" sniper rifle. However, it has a folding stock, can fire in bursts, and has a larger magazine. Originally designed for special forces units operating in conditions demanding silenced and supressed fire.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x39mm PAB-9
 Armor-Piercing 9x39mm SP-6
 Sniper 9x39mm SP-5
A modified AS "Val" rifle that allows the attatchment of the PSO-1 optical sight.

A special sniper rifle designed for silenced and suppressed sniper fire. Equipped with an integrated silencer and can pierce any bulletproof vest at a range of up to 400 meters. Highly valued by Stalkers of any level.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x39mm PAB-9
 Armor-Piercing 9x39mm SP-6
 Sniper 9x39mm SP-5

An excellent pistol. A highly accurate and reliable gun with a high capacity magazine.
 Ammunition:
 Standard 9x19mm FMJ
 Improved 9x19mm PB1s
A modified Walther P99 that utilizes 9x18mm rounds.

A very reliable, smooth-bore, pump-action shotgun made for use in hostile environments.
 Ammunition:
 12x70 buckshot
 12x76 slug
 12x76 dart

Self-made flamethrower by a Freedom member Screw. It is loaded with a two-component mixture made of colloid gas type 'F' and products of oil. This mixture ignites in air so the apparatus is pretty simple. However, because the mixture reacts so vigorously there are details in the apparatus that have been made of hi-tech anti-corrosion materials that could only be produced in a laboratory environment. Also, the only person that knows the secret of production of the mixture is Screw. Because of that the flamethrower did not become a device used by masses, even taking in account that it is one of the most powerful weapons in the Zone.

In 1961 the PK/PKS machine gun ('Kalashnikov/machine gun Kalashnikov mounted machine gun', Index 6P3) was adopted for service on the basis of which were developed later on the PKB machine gun intended for armored personnel carriers and the PKT machine gun intended for tanks. In 1969 the PKM (6P6) modernized machine gun with reduced weight by 1.5 kg and a number of changes: the ribs of the barrel were removed, flash suppressor, operating handle, buttplate and trigger guard were changed while the receiver cover was reinforced and introduced the folded shoulder rest. The machine gun features the rapidly removed barrel, it is a gas-operated weapon with the gas-regulator and the barrel locked by the bolt rotation. The operating handle is arranged to the right and remains stationary during the fire. The firing mechanism intended only for automatic mode of fire. The fire is delivered from the rear sear. The thumb safety locks the trigger. The machine gun is fed from the cartridge-belt activated by the lever mechanism located to the right. The feeding of cartridges from the belt link is not straight. The ports of the receiver and the magazine are covered by the spring-actuated shields.
